Data from the Research Organization Registry Community

Source: vignettes/ror.Rmd
ror.Rmd
library(institutions)
library(dplyr)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'dplyr'
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union

institutions_download()

A static dataset from October 2020 from the Research Organization Registry Community has been bundled in this R package.

It provides GRID identifiers for research organizations and can therefore be used to link to the data otherwise provided through functions in this R package.

Some examples of usage follow:


# get a GRID identifier for a specific institution
id_kth_grid <- 
  institutions_search("Royal Institute of Technology")$grid_id

# get the corresponding ROR identifier
id_kth_ror <- 
  ror$ror_orgs %>%
  filter(GRID == id_kth_grid) %>%
  pull(id)

# what ROR core info can we get for this identifier?
ror$ror_orgs %>% filter(id == id_kth_ror) %>% glimpse()
#> Rows: 1
#> Columns: 19
#> $ id            <chr> "https://ror.org/026vcq606"
#> $ name          <chr> "Royal Institute of Technology"
#> $ status        <chr> "active"
#> $ wikipedia_url <chr> "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Royal_Institute_of_Technol…
#> $ email_address <chr> NA
#> $ established   <int> 1827
#> $ country_code  <chr> "SE"
#> $ country_name  <chr> "Sweden"
#> $ ISNI          <chr> NA
#> $ FundRef       <chr> NA
#> $ OrgRef        <chr> NA
#> $ Wikidata      <chr> NA
#> $ GRID          <chr> "grid.5037.1"
#> $ HESA          <lgl> NA
#> $ UCAS          <lgl> NA
#> $ UKPRN         <chr> NA
#> $ CNRS          <lgl> NA
#> $ LinkedIn      <lgl> NA
#> $ Ringgold      <lgl> NA

# what other identifiers are associated with this org?
ror$ror_ids %>% filter(id == id_kth_ror)
#> # A tibble: 5 × 3
#>   id                        name     value           
#>   <chr>                     <chr>    <chr>           
#> 1 https://ror.org/026vcq606 ISNI     0000000121581746
#> 2 https://ror.org/026vcq606 FundRef  501100004270    
#> 3 https://ror.org/026vcq606 OrgRef   25609           
#> 4 https://ror.org/026vcq606 Wikidata Q854280         
#> 5 https://ror.org/026vcq606 GRID     grid.5037.1

# ROR child table entries for labels, aliases, acronyms, links and types?

# what aliases?
ror$ror_aliases %>% filter(id == id_kth_ror)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 2
#>   id                        aliases                    
#>   <chr>                     <chr>                      
#> 1 https://ror.org/026vcq606 Kungliga Tekniska högskolan

# what acronyms?
ror$ror_acronyms %>% filter(id == id_kth_ror)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 2
#>   id                        acronyms
#>   <chr>                     <chr>   
#> 1 https://ror.org/026vcq606 KTH

# what links?
ror$ror_links %>% filter(id == id_kth_ror)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 2
#>   id                        links               
#>   <chr>                     <chr>               
#> 1 https://ror.org/026vcq606 http://www.kth.se/en

# what types?
ror$ror_types %>% filter(id == id_kth_ror)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 2
#>   id                        types    
#>   <chr>                     <chr>    
#> 1 https://ror.org/026vcq606 Education

Some summaries

The full dataset is available and can be summarized.

Using “child tables” for summaries

A few examples:


# what top five types of orgs are represented in this data?
ror$ror_types %>% count(types) %>% arrange(desc(n)) %>% head(5)
#> # A tibble: 5 × 2
#>   types          n
#>   <chr>      <int>
#> 1 Company    29498
#> 2 Education  19819
#> 3 Nonprofit  13796
#> 4 Healthcare 12972
#> 5 Facility    9302

# top 5 companies with many aliases
ror$ror_aliases %>% count(aliases) %>% arrange(desc(n)) %>% head(5)
#> # A tibble: 5 × 2
#>   aliases                                         n
#>   <chr>                                       <int>
#> 1 Merck Sharp & Dohme                            22
#> 2 Hoffmann-La Roche                              12
#> 3 ASEA Brown Boveri                              11
#> 4 E. I. du Pont de Nemours and Company           11
#> 5 International Business Machines Corporation    11

# why does IBM have so many acronyms? seemingly because it is a multi-national corp.
ror$ror_aliases %>% filter(aliases == "International Business Machines Corporation") %>% 
  inner_join(ror$ror_orgs) %>%  pull(name) %>% paste0(collapse = ", ")
#> Joining, by = "id"
#> [1] "IBM (France), IBM (Germany), IBM (Belgium), IBM (India), IBM (Egypt), IBM (Denmark), IBM (Portugal), IBM (Czechia), IBM (Ireland), IBM (Brazil), IBM (Slovakia)"

# what is the most frequently used acronym and which orgs use this abbreviation for its name?
ror$ror_acronyms %>% count(acronyms) %>% arrange(desc(n))
#> # A tibble: 29,347 × 2
#>    acronyms     n
#>    <chr>    <int>
#>  1 CCC         39
#>  2 AU          31
#>  3 HCC         30
#>  4 SCC         30
#>  5 MU          29
#>  6 MCC         28
#>  7 CRC         26
#>  8 BU          25
#>  9 CMC         25
#> 10 MSU         24
#> # … with 29,337 more rows
ror$ror_acronyms %>% filter(acronyms == "CCC") %>% inner_join(ror$ror_orgs) %>% pull(name) %>% paste0(collapse = ", ")
#> Joining, by = "id"
#> [1] "Clatterbridge Cancer Centre NHS Foundation Trust, Committee on Climate Change, Camden County College, Capital Consulting Corporation (United States), IEA Clean Coal Centre, Colby Community College, Crile Carvey Consulting, Childhood Cancer Canada Foundation, Children's Cancer Center, Community Cancer Center, Capital Community College, Clatsop Community College, Central City Concern, Corning Community College, Cleveland Community College, California Coastal Commission, California Conservation Corps, Canola Council of Canada, Chinese Culture Center of San Francisco, Clearwater Christian College, Clackamas Community College, Clovis Community College, Coahoma Community College, Cumberland County College, Carolina Christian College, Consolidated Contractors Company (Greece), Community Care College, California Christian College, Craven Community College, Coffeyville Community College, Carteret Community College, Clinton Community College, Center for Community Change, Bowel Cancer UK, Carbohydrate Competence Center, Cancer Research UK Cambridge Center, Sport Wales, Crichton Carbon Centre, Comprehensive Cancer Center Vienna"

# some orgs have more than one link, seems to be duplicates?
ror$ror_links %>% group_by(id) %>% count(links) %>% filter(n > 1) %>% ungroup()
#> # A tibble: 5 × 3
#>   id                        links                                  n
#>   <chr>                     <chr>                              <int>
#> 1 https://ror.org/01eea1w69 https://www.southernwater.co.uk/       2
#> 2 https://ror.org/01s165k42 https://www.herffjones.com/            2
#> 3 https://ror.org/02qj02q19 http://www.eis-africa.org/             2
#> 4 https://ror.org/03efxbk04 http://genosys.com/                    2
#> 5 https://ror.org/05r9c7f43 https://publichealth.berkeley.edu/     2
ror$ror_links %>% filter(id == "https://ror.org/01eea1w69") 
#> # A tibble: 2 × 2
#>   id                        links                           
#>   <chr>                     <chr>                           
#> 1 https://ror.org/01eea1w69 https://www.southernwater.co.uk/
#> 2 https://ror.org/01eea1w69 https://www.southernwater.co.uk/

External identifiers


extids <- ror$ror_ids

# which external identifiers are most frequently provided?
# one given identifier can have multiple other identifiers esp FundRef
extids %>%
  group_by(name) %>%
  count() %>%
  arrange(desc(n))
#> # A tibble: 11 × 2
#> # Groups:   name [11]
#>    name          n
#>    <chr>     <int>
#>  1 GRID     102392
#>  2 ISNI      49349
#>  3 Wikidata  47929
#>  4 OrgRef    15689
#>  5 FundRef   12629
#>  6 CNRS        822
#>  7 UKPRN       175
#>  8 HESA        171
#>  9 UCAS        156
#> 10 LinkedIn      7
#> 11 Ringgold      2

# which WikiData identifiers does a set of orgs have?
ids_wikidata <- 
  extids %>% filter(
  id %in% c("https://ror.org/052gg0110", "https://ror.org/013meh722"),
  name == "Wikidata") %>%
  distinct() %>%
  pull("value")

knitr::kable(escape = FALSE, tibble(url = sprintf("<a href='https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/%s'>%s</a>", ids_wikidata, ids_wikidata)))
url

Q56612600
